DataElement.preferredName: Postmenopausal Hormone Treatment Phase Tissue Collection Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A grouping of items based on the postmenopausal hormone treatment phase when tissue is collected.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Postmenopausal Hormone Treating Phase Tissue Collection
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the time after menopause. Menopause ("change of life") is the time in a woman's life when menstrual periods stop permanently._Chemical substances having a specific regulatory effect on the activity of a certain organ or organs. The term was originally applied to substances secreted by various endocrine glands and transported in the bloodstream to the target organs. It is sometimes extended to include those substances that are not produced by the endocrine glands but that have similar effects._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process._A distinguishable part, a stage in a series of events or in a process of development, e.g. any of the varying aspects or stages in course of a disease; a fraction of a cycle._Providing treatment for._An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the time after menopause. Menopause ("change of life") is the time in a woman's life when menstrual periods stop permanently.:Chemical substances having a specific regulatory effect on the activity of a certain organ or organs. The term was originally applied to substances secreted by various endocrine glands and transported in the bloodstream to the target organs. It is sometimes extended to include those substances that are not produced by the endocrine glands but that have similar effects.:Providing treatment for.:A distinguishable part, a stage in a series of events or in a process of development, e.g. any of the varying aspects or stages in course of a disease; a fraction of a cycle.

Concepts.definition: Chemical substances having a specific regulatory effect on the activity of a certain organ or organs. The term was originally applied to substances secreted by various endocrine glands and transported in the bloodstream to the target organs. It is sometimes extended to include those substances that are not produced by the endocrine glands but that have similar effects.
A distinguishable part, a stage in a series of events or in a process of development, e.g. any of the varying aspects or stages in course of a disease; a fraction of a cycle.

Property.preferredDefinition: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.:The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

Concepts.definition: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A class of sex hormones associated with the development and maintenance of secondary female sex characteristics and control of the cyclical changes in the reproductive cycle. They are also required for pregnancy maintenance and have an anabolic effect on protein metabolism and water retention.: Any natural or laboratory-made substance that has some or all of the biologic effects of progesterone, a female hormone.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: A distinguishable part, a stage in a series of events or in a process of development, e.g. any of the varying aspects or stages in course of a disease; a fraction of a cycle.

Concepts.definition: A class of sex hormones associated with the development and maintenance of secondary female sex characteristics and control of the cyclical changes in the reproductive cycle. They are also required for pregnancy maintenance and have an anabolic effect on protein metabolism and water retention.
Any synthetic steroid hormone that resembles the naturally occurring hormone and has progesterone-like properties.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
A distinguishable part, a stage in a series of events or in a process of development, e.g. any of the varying aspects or stages in course of a disease; a fraction of a cycle.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A class of sex hormones associated with the development and maintenance of secondary female sex characteristics and control of the cyclical changes in the reproductive cycle. They are also required for pregnancy maintenance and have an anabolic effect on protein metabolism and water retention.: A distinguishable part, a stage in a series of events or in a process of development, e.g. any of the varying aspects or stages in course of a disease; a fraction of a cycle.

Concepts.definition: A class of sex hormones associated with the development and maintenance of secondary female sex characteristics and control of the cyclical changes in the reproductive cycle. They are also required for pregnancy maintenance and have an anabolic effect on protein metabolism and water retention.
A distinguishable part, a stage in a series of events or in a process of development, e.g. any of the varying aspects or stages in course of a disease; a fraction of a cycle.
